New Records: Alex Hales returned to international cricket with a crucial half-century after his recall.
Debutant Luke Wood claimed three wickets on his first appearance for England.
Key Match Events: Alex Hales scored 53 runs in his first match since 2019, leading England to a six-wicket victory.
Pakistan got off to a fast start with Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam scoring heavily before losing six wickets in the second half of the innings.
Milestones or significant achievements: Alex Hales marked his return with a vital performance, ending his international exile.
Luke Wood made a promising debut with an economical spell and crucial wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in front of a sell-out crowd of 35,000 at Karachiâ€™s National Stadium, marking the first T20I in Pakistan after almost 17 years.
